summary: This document is a chain of emails from 2021 between Jordy Feldman, the Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, and law enforcement officials. Feldman is seeking to connect with the FBI and NYPD regarding the program and reports receiving threatening communications from a disgruntled claimant. The emails show coordination between the compensation program administrator and investigators.

persons.name: Jordy Feldman
persons.role: Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
persons.context: The primary sender of the emails, seeking to coordinate with law enforcement about the compensation program and reporting threatening communications from a claimant.

persons.name: Amanda
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent with the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, whom Feldman is trying to contact for information.

persons.name: Elena Voumas
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence, appears to be a colleague or staff member of Jordy Feldman.

persons.name: Walter E.
persons.context: An NYPD detective with the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force who referred Feldman to Special Agent Amanda.

connections.description: Feldman is attempting to establish contact with Special Agent Amanda to discuss the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program and seek general information about the investigation.
Detective Walter E. referred Feldman's inquiry to Special Agent Amanda, indicating a prior point of contact.
Voumas is consistently copied on Feldman's emails, indicating she is part of the compensation program team.

events.title: Initial Outreach to Law Enforcement
events.description: Jordy Feldman sends initial emails to Detective Walter E. and later to Special Agent Amanda, introducing himself as the Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program and requesting a call.

events.title: Scheduled Call Between Feldman and FBI
events.description: Feldman and Special Agent Amanda coordinate to have a phone call at 4:00 PM to discuss the compensation program.

events.title: Report of Threatening Communications
events.description: Feldman forwards an email to colleagues reporting that a disgruntled claimant has sent threatening emails and voicemails, including threats of bodily harm, over the past year.

events.title: Forwarding of Concerning Claimant Email
events.description: Feldman forwards another 'concerning email' from a claimant, describing the allegations as without merit but troubling due to personal information invoked.

locations: NYPD Detective Bureau Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force
keyFacts: Jordy Feldman was the Administrator of the independent Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (VCP) as of 2021.
The VCP administrator was actively seeking to coordinate and share information with the FBI and NYPD investigators handling the Epstein case.
The program administrator reported receiving threatening communications, including threats of bodily harm, from a disgruntled claimant over a period of at least a year.
Law enforcement communication shows a referral chain from an NYPD detective to an FBI Special Agent specializing in Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking.
